column7: Long pass over 35 yards
A ball played in from wide areas into the box
Pass made with a players head
Ball played through for player making an attacking run to create a chance on goal
Any free kick; direct or indirect
All corners. Look for qualifier 6 but excluding qualifier 2 for short corners
Player who was in an offside position when pass was made.
Pass led to a goal disallowed for a foul or offside
A pass in the opposition’s half of the pitch
Throw-in taken
The x pitch coordinate for the end point of a pass - See Appendix 11
The y pitch coordinate for the end point of a pass - See Appendix 11
Pass which was chipped into the air
Pass where player laid the ball into the path of a teammates run
Pass played from a player’s own half up towards front players. Aimed to hit a zone rather than a specific player
Pass where a player has "flicked" the ball forward using their head
Player in opposition’s penalty box reaches the by-line and passes (cuts) the ball backwards to a teammate
Any pass which crosses the centre zone of the pitch and in length is greater than 60 on the y axis of the pitch
The pass was an assist for a shot. The type of shot then dictates whether it was a goal assist or just key pass.
The estimated length the ball has travelled during the associated event.
The angle the ball travels at during an event relative to the direction of play. Shown in radians.
Pass was deemed a 2nd assist - created the opportunity for another player to assist a goal
Assigned to event 6 indicating there were defensive players on both posts when a corner was taken
Assigned to event 6 indicating there was a defensive player on only the near post when a corner was taken
Assigned to event 6 indicating there was a defensive player on only the far post when corner was taken
Assigned to event 6 indicating there were no defensive players on either post when a corner was taken
Corner was crossed into the box swerving towards the goal
Corner was crossed into the box swerving away from the goal
Corner was crossed into the box with a straight ball flight
Any event where the player used their head such as a shot or a clearance
Player shot with their left foot
Player shot with right footed
Shot was neither via a player’s head or foot for example knee or chest
Shot during open play as opposed to from a set play￼
Shot occurred following a fast break situation
Shot occurred from a crossed free kick
Shot occurred from a corner
Shot occurred directly from a free kick
Pass or shot event in corner situation. 25 is used when the goal is direct from corner, 96 relates to 2nd phase attack.
26 will be used for shot directly from a free kick. 97 only used with Opta GoalData (game system 4) but not with full data.
Goal where there was a scramble for possession of the ball and the defence had an opportunity to clear
Shot came from a throw-in set piece
Indicates that there was a pass (assist) from another player to set up the goal opportunity
Shot from an intentional assist i.e. The assisting player intended the pass, no deflection etc
This will appear for goals or shots, the related event_id will be that of the assist and thus show the assisting player ID
If there was a 2nd assist, i.e a pass to create the opportunity for the player making the assist. MLS and German Bundesliga 1 & 2.
When attempt on goal was a penalty kick. ALSO used on Event type 4 to indicate a penalty was awarded
Own goal . Note: Use the inverse coordinates of the goal location
Shot on the volley (ball doesn't bounce before the shot) – NO LONGER USED
Shot via overhead kick – NO LONGER USED
Shot on the half volley (hit immediately after the ball bounces) – NO LONGER USED
Shot where the player dives to head the ball – NO LONGER USED
Shot was subjectively classed as strong
Shot was subjectively classed as weak
Shot was rising in the air
Shot was dipping towards the ground
Shot was an attempt by the attacker to play the ball over the goalkeeper and into the goal
Shot where the ball bounced once on its way towards the goal – NO LONGER USED
Shot where the ball bounced several times on its way to the goal – NO LONGER USED
Shot which swerves to the left - from attackers perspective
Shot which swerves to the right - from attackers perspective
Shot which swerves in several directions
Shot deflected off another player
Goal where the goalkeeper got a touch on the ball as it went in
Shot going wide or over the goal but still collected/saved by the goalkeeper with event type 15
Any shot which hits the post or crossbar
Shot missed which does not pass the goal line
Shot was deemed by Opta analysts an excellent opportunity to score – clear cut chance eg one on one
Player created the chance to shoot by himself, not assisted. For example he dribbled to create space for himself and shot.
Indicates that this shot had a significant pass to create the opportunity for the pass which led to a goal
Player blocks an attacking shot unintentionally from their teammate

column7: Event type 32 - Actual direction of play in relation to TV camera. X/Y coordinates however are ALWAYS all normalized to Left to Right.
